page.title: 10R.A.F. Stafford.(16-M.U.).
page.content: Ten children went to R.A.F. Stafford (16 M.U.) on the 5th July 1985. We discovered that R.A.F. Stafford is a supplies base and no planes land there, only helicopters. 2,000 people work on site, half being irmen the other half being civilians. The site supplies and maintains aeroplane parts for all the "active" R.A.F.sites throughout England. At present stocks are kept for the latest "Tornado" bomber. R.A.F. Stafford had a large part to play in the Falklands War,supplying aircraft spares and equipment. On the site there are plenty of clubs and "off duty" activities.There is a band, football golf and cricket clubs,a gymnasium and even a pottery club!
